# WCF Feature Details

> Documentation for WCF Feature Details.

*Topics available: 422*

- [Authorization in WCF](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/authorization-in-wcf.md): Learn more about: Authorization in WCF

- [Best Practices for Reliable Sessions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/best-practices-for-reliable-sessions.md): Learn more about: Best Practices for Reliable Sessions

- [Bindings and Security](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/bindings-and-security.md): Find out how to select the right binding for your security needs. The system-provided bindings included with WCF provide a quick way to program WCF applications.
- [Bindings in WCF](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/bindings.md): Learn more about: Windows Communication Foundation Bindings

- [Caching Support for WCF Web HTTP Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/caching-support-for-wcf-web-http-services.md): Learn more about: Caching Support for WCF Web HTTP Services
- [Calling a REST-style service from a WCF service](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/calling-a-rest-style-service-from-a-wcf-service.md): Learn how to make a WCF service use the right context with a REST-style service by creating a scope and calling the REST-style service from that scope.
- [Certificate Validation Differences Between HTTPS, SSL over TCP, and SOAP Security](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/cert-val-diff-https-ssl-over-tcp-and-soap.md): Learn about certificates with message-layer (SOAP) security that WCF offers in addition to HTTPS or TCP, and how WCF validates such certificates.
- [Changing the Cache Sharing Levels for Send Activities](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/changing-the-cache-sharing-levels-for-send-activities.md): Learn more about: Changing the Cache Sharing Levels for Send Activities

- [Choosing a Transport](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/choosing-a-transport.md): Learn about criteria for choosing among the main transports that WCF offers: HTTP, TCP, and named pipes.

- [Client Configuration](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/client-configuration.md): Learn how to use WCF client configuration to specify the address, binding, behavior, and contract for an endpoint, which is used to connect to a service.
- [Clients](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/clients.md): Learn more about: Clients
- [Collection Types in Data Contracts](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/collection-types-in-data-contracts.md): Learn about how the data contract model treats collections in the .NET Framework and how WCF supports data serialization for collection types.

Configure a URL registration and a Firewall exception by using Netsh.exe.

- [Data Contract Names](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-contract-names.md): Discover data contract and member naming rules and default behavior of the WCF infrastructure, which support communication by using equivalent data contracts.
- [Data Contract Schema Reference](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-contract-schema-reference.md): Learn more about: Data Contract Schema Reference

- [Data Member Default Values](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-member-default-values.md): Learn how to omit a data member from serialized data when it has a .NET Framework default value. WCF can improve performance by not serializing a default.
- [Data Member Order](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-member-order.md): Learn about data member order in WCF. Applications might need to know or change the order in which data members are sent or expected.

Either can initiate calls to the other.

These security mechanisms depend on the binding and transport used.
- [Transport security with an anonymous client](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/transport-security-with-an-anonymous-client.md): Review this WCF scenario, which uses transport security to authenticate a server by using a certificate that the client trusts. The client is not authenticated.
- [Transport Security with Basic Authentication](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/transport-security-with-basic-authentication.md): Review this WCF scenario, which shows basic authentication for a WCF service and client. The service needs a valid certificate that the client trusts.

In this example, an intranet service displays human resources information.
